climbs.name: Psychokinesis
climbs.fa: Tony Yaniro & Ron Carson or Alan Bell & Vaino Kodas, 1983

content.description: Psychokinesis (aka Missing in Action) ascends the prominent left facing corner on the south face of the formation. Begin by climbing a difficult ramp in an overhanging corner (crux). Continue up the corner climbing a pleasant crack until it closes down. Face climb past an adventurous section and then continue more easily to the top.
content.protection: Small to medium cams, wires, RPs
content.location: Left facing corner on the south face of the formation

climbs.name: Polytechnics
climbs.fa: Tony Yaniro, Graham Peace, Toivo Kodas, Feb 1984

content.description: Start below a shallow ramp. Â Fun and varied face climbing up and right to the bolted anchor.
content.protection: Copperhead then 3 bolts to 2 bolt rap anchor

content.description: Climb the offwidth (crux), go over an overhang, and up the finger crack (5.10A) above.
content.protection: a light rack of normal-size gear, plus a 5.5 inch and a 7 inch cam
content.location: This is the obvious, straight-in offwidth near the center of the west face.

content.description: This is a clean, technical offwidth with a very rounded outside edge.  It takes knee locks well, but the rounded edge makes reaching in for hand stacks tricky.
content.protection: I placed one 4" cam and one 5" cam
content.location: This is on the south face.  It's an obvious offwidth crack in a corner, that ends on a large ledge at mid-height.
